Description: Typical range for ns-pulsed Nd:YAG lasers in stone cleaning applications; starting at 50W to avoid thermal damage to calcite (decomposition ~825°C). Max limited to prevent substrate ablation. Source: IPG Photonics YLR series specs and studies on carbonate cleaning (e.g., J. Cult. Herit. 2018).
Near-IR wavelength for efficient Calcite absorption with minimal transmission
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning resolution on Calcite surfaces
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning with thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for controlled ablation of Calcite surface contaminants
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for complete contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive energy deposition
